      The GUI writes messages into this pipe, and the underlying client reads messages from this pipe and sends them to the server.

        private javax.swing.JTextField newMessageArea
        The text field that the user enters messages into.

      • messageHistoryListModel

        private javax.swing.DefaultListModel<java.lang.String> messageHistoryListModel
        When data is written to this list model, it is displayed in the previous message area.

      • messageHistoryJList

        private javax.swing.JList<java.lang.String> messageHistoryJList
        The JList in which previous messages are placed

      • serverPortNum

        private int serverPortNum
        The server port number entered by the user.

      • serverHostname

        private java.lang.String serverHostname
        The server hostname entered by the user.

      • newMessage

        private java.lang.String newMessage
        Each time a new message is to be sent, it is stored in this field.

      • chatClientThread

        private ChatClient chatClientThread
        Only one client instance can run per GUI. This is the client's thread.

      • msgsFromGuiToClientStream

        private java.io.PipedOutputStream msgsFromGuiToClientStream
        The GUI writes messages into this pipe, and the underlying client reads messages from this pipe and sends them to the server.

      • msgsFromGuiToClientWriter

        private java.io.PrintWriter msgsFromGuiToClientWriter
        Strings are printed to this writer and then are passed through the msgsFromGuiClientStream pipe to be read by the client.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatClientGui

        public ChatClientGui()
        Constructor for the GUI. This does a bunch of graphics initialization in addition to displaying some introductory strings in the previous message window and the message submission field.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Launch the application.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Initialize the contents of the frame. This is all generated by Window Builder Pro.

      • initializeMsgOutputStreamAndWriter

        private void initializeMsgOutputStreamAndWriter()
        Initialize the stream and writer that interface with the underlying ChatClient thread.

      • createClient

        private void createClient()
        Creates a new ChatClient, which represents an instance of a client connected to a ChatServer. Only one instance is allowed per GUI, which is enforced by this function.

      • closeGuiMsgStreamAndWriter

        void closeGuiMsgStreamAndWriter()
        Closing the stream and writer is needed to allow for a client to reconnect to the server if it has already disconnected. In addition, the server monitor thread will call close the stream to wakeup the user input thread to have it close in the even that there was an expected disconnect.

      • displayTextInHistoryWindow

        void displayTextInHistoryWindow(java.lang.String msg)
        Write a new line to the previous messages window. Then, scroll down to show this new message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to be displayed.

      • getMessagesFromGuiStream

        java.io.PipedOutputStream getMessagesFromGuiStream()
        Getter for the PipedOutputStream that the GUI writes into. The client connects to the other side of the stream by retrieving and connecting to this PipedOutputStream object.
        Returns:
        The GUI's msgsFromGuiToClientStream PipedOutputStream

      • displayExceptionMsg

        void displayExceptionMsg(java.lang.String otherMsg,
                         java.lang.Exception except)
        Display a JOptionPane error message window which shows an error string in addition to the stack trace of the exception parameter.
        Parameters:
        otherMsg - A message to show before the stack trace
        except - An exception whose stack trace is to be displayed.

      • displayErrorMsg

        void displayErrorMsg(java.lang.String errMsg)
        Show a JOptionPane error message dialog which contains the specified message.
        Parameters:
        errMsg - The message to display
